message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.CC, cs.SI

The paper deals with the computational complexity of finding Nash equilibria in network coordination games, which is a topic in game theory (cs.GT). The paper also involves analyzing the probability of a slow increase in potential during the better-response algorithm, which involves techniques from probability theory and data structures (cs.DS). The paper proposes smoothed efficient algorithms for finding Nash equilibria, which involves techniques from artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and computational complexity (cs.CC). The paper also discusses reductions from network coordination games to local-max-cut, which involves techniques from graph theory and optimization (cs.SI).
